page.title: 01Toab
page.content: The area known as Toab is the SE part of the parish of St Andrews, on the east mainland of Orkney. It is a farming area, mainly intensively farmed grassland for cattle and sheep. There is a mixture of small holdings and fairly large farms. The high areas are moorland and peat bogs. These are being drained and ploughed for farming. This area has a primary school which serves St Andrews and Deerness, a grocers shop, which opens all hours, and a Post Office. There are two archaeological sites, the standing stone at Stembister and Dingieshowe Broch, both are at least 4000 years old. St Peters pool to the east is a sheltered sandy inlet popular for catching Muscles and Whelks. South east is Dingieshowe Bay excellent for catching Lobsters.
